title: Can we make it so we can give a reason why we chose to give a player honor after the match?

replies.body: Riot should actually make the honor system something worth noticing, then add this. Also, make it so that you can see who sent you that message.
"i fuckin hate you but i honored you to let you know"

yeah, i guess this is the problem... :'( , maybe some sort of notification that u can click to read if the reason if u want, and it would have the name of the person so u know if its harass... but idk if that would be helpful at all to prevent it.
If they felt that way then they would have had the entire game/post screen to do such harassment already, it's so niche that that's unnecessary.

Free honor.
¯\_(ツ)_/¯
#werf

No, because the honour system is pointless. All that matters is that we report negative players, positive players who provided us with good experiences deserve no rewards!
But in all seriousness, when I first started the game people used to honour others left and right.
Now post lobby is full of people screaming REPORT REPORT.
Riot is working on a system that rewards both the positive players and those who recognize them.
Soon.(tm)
after replays
And then they post-pone it for a couple years citing new ideas and technical difficulties
IKR, I used to get like 3 honors a game, now I'm lucky if I get one. And my attitude has only improved from then.

They already do kinda...

It would be nice to let other players know why I honored them after the game. Similar to how we can give a brief explanation when we report a player.
"hey I liked your postive attitude (friendly)"
"nice play calling (teamwork)"
"you're funny (friendly)"
etc.
So being funny and having a positive attitude is the same thing? There are only 3 things to honor an ally for and 1 thing to honor an enemy for. Yet, there are a hundred reasons.

kind of, people having a sense of humor about things instead of being a douche is a positive attitude. granted maybe they could add categories underneath, but keep in mind the crests of honor balance system, so if nothing else they can keep the general 3 categories and go from there

Sometimes some1 is neutral for most of the game but he goes and does that one single thing that cheers u up and u want to honor that, it would be really cool if u can point out that one moment, sometimes those moments decide a match.

It honestly needs to be more in your face, most people are just gonna gravitate to the play again button over anything else..if they were to give us the ability (within like a match or two) to do it from match history or the recently played tab that might be good too?

Well, it would be easy enough to not give you the message from anyone you have Ignored. That being said, as others have said the game no longer encourages honoring people anyway, so it hardly ever happens.
I find it a fantastic idea.

I am surprised they haven't just removed the system entirely. They've done absolutely nothing with it since launch, and people hardly care enough to click the buttons anymore because it's totally pointless.

It was a nice experiment, but it's time to actually do something with it or just get rid of it all together.

yes please

As the top post says, they need to make honoring someone worth something. Then they can start adding shit. 

Possibly something like if you get a certain amounts of honorable opponents you get some free IP. Idk just a suggestion

"You were so bad that you lost the game all alone for your team, thx baddie"

Well as someone said there is already enough time to really flame somebody earlier like in end screen and in game, plus if there is a reward in getting honors you will basically get free rewards from people flaming you, and I would not be sad if that happened.

I give enemy players honor for being great sportsmen and playing their champion well. 

I give my teammates honor for great teamwork, great attitude, or carrying the team.

really though, those 3 options don't really cut it. also the honorable opponent doesn't give you anything to say hey you did good on X
If someone is such a great person that you feel you should tell them. Then I think you should take the time to send them a message rather than make Riot do it for you.
I wholeheartedly agree. More avenues for positive reinforcement within the community would help further instill better sportsmanlike attitude between players.

Yeah I think it is messed up that we have so many different ways to report a person but we only have 3 ways to tell someone that I thought they were a good person. Or at least be able to leave a note to them that they can see I think this is what you were trying to say.

I think this would be a good idea; but I also feel like the honor system is weak in itself. There's just no reason to honor unless someone does something exemplary like a pentakill. Maybe something like this could boost it's worth though. Good thought
